DOC.brief_summary: The aim study compare , patient acute respiratory failure/acute lung injury efficacy three different method oxygenation prevent endotracheal intubation : 1. conventional oxygen therapy ( O2 conventional ) 2. high flow nasal oxygen therapy ( O2-HFN ) 3. association high flow nasal oxygen therapy non invasive positive pressure ventilation ( O2-HFN/NPPV ) .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Effect Association Noninvasive Ventilation High Flow Nasal Oxygen Therapy Resuscitation Patients With Acute Lung Injury ( FLORALI Study )
DOC.criteria: Hypoxemic hypercapnic acute respiratory failure : severe dyspnea rest respiratory rate > 25 breaths/min PaO2/FiO2 < 300 PaCO2 < 45 mmHg , age < 18 year NPPV contraindication past history respiratory chronic disease ( COPD , cystic fibrosis… ) cardiac pulmonary edema Predefined intubation respiratory organ failure : systolic pressure < 90 mmHg , current treatment epinephrine norepinephrine , decrease level consciousness ( Glasgow score ≤ 12 ) profound aplasia ( white cell count < 1000/mm 3 )
